meanings.definition: To be seated on a throne.
meanings.sent1: The king throned on his golden chair.
meanings.sent2: She throned gracefully during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat throned on the top of the couch like a royal feline.
meanings.sent4: The sun throned in the sky, casting its warm light over the land.
meanings.sent5: The queen throned with elegance, commanding attention from all.

meanings.sent1: They throned the crown on the new monarch's head.
meanings.sent2: The loyal subjects throned the prince with great ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully throned their teddy bear on a makeshift throne.
meanings.sent4: The artist throned the statue in the center of the gallery, drawing all eyes to it.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter throned the beautifully carved chair in the grand hall, completing the royal setting.
